name: Synogium Albo
climate: Synogium Albo prefers tropical climates with warm temperatures.
This plant thrives in high humidity environments and consistent warmth.
Avoid exposure to cold drafts or temperatures below 60 degrees Fahrenheit.
The ideal climate is similar to its native Asian forests, warm and humid.
sunlight: Synogium Albo enjoys bright, indirect sunlight for optimal growth.
Direct sunlight can scorch the leaves, so filtered light is best.
Too little light can cause the plant to become leggy and lose variegation.
A location with consistent dappled sunlight throughout the day is ideal.
watering: Water the Synogium Albo when the top inch of soil feels dry to touch.
Avoid overwatering; ensure the pot has drainage to prevent root rot.
During the growing season, aim to keep the soil consistently moist.
Reduce watering frequency in winter but do not let the soil completely dry out.
soil: A well-draining potting mix with peat or coco coir is recommended.
Including perlite or sand in the soil mix improves drainage significantly.
The soil should retain some moisture but not stay overly soggy or compact.
An airy and loose soil structure will support healthy root development.
toxic: Synogium Albo is toxic if ingested by pets or humans, causing irritation.
extra_care_tip: Regularly wipe leaves with a damp cloth to keep them dust-free and healthy.
